t: Matthew 13
The Parable of the Sower
On*p the same day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the sea.
And great multitudes were gathered together to Him, so that He got into a boat and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.
Then*p He spoke many things to them in parables, saying: “Behold,*r a*r sower*r went*r out*r to*r sow.*r
And*r as*r he*r sowed,*r some*r seed*ir fell*r by*r the*r wayside;*r and*r the*r birds*r came*r and*r devoured*r them.*r
Some*r fell*r on*r stony*r places,*r where*r they*r did*r not*r have*r much*r earth;*r and*r they*r immediately*r sprang*r up*r because*r they*r had*r no*r depth*r of*r earth.*r
But*r when*r the*r sun*r was*r up*r they*r were*r scorched,*r and*r because*r they*r had*r no*r root*r they*r withered*r away.*r
And*r some*r fell*r among*r thorns,*r and*r the*r thorns*r sprang*r up*r and*r choked*r them.*r
But*r others*r fell*r on*r good*r ground*r and*r yielded*r a*r crop:*r some*r a*r hundredfold,*r some*r sixty,*r some*r thirty.*r
He*r who*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear!”*r

And*p the disciples came and said to Him, “Why do You speak to them in parables?”
He*p answered and said to them, “Because*r it*r has*r been*r given*r to*r you*r to*r know*r the*r mysteries*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven,*r but*r to*r them*r it*r has*r not*r been*r given.*r

Therefore*r I*r speak*r to*r them*r in*r parables,*r because*r seeing*r they*r do*r not*r see,*r and*r hearing*r they*r do*r not*r hear,*r nor*r do*r they*r understand.*r

And*r in*r them*r the*r prophecy*r of*r Isaiah*r is*r fulfilled,*r which*r says:*r ‘Hearing*rpn you*r will*r hear*r and*r shall*r not*r understand,*r And*rld seeing*r you*r will*r see*r and*r not*r perceive;*r

For*rld the*r hearts*r of*r this*r people*r have*r grown*r dull.*r Their*irld ears*r are*r hard*r of*r hearing,*r And*rld their*r eyes*r they*r have*r closed,*r Lest*rld they*r should*r see*r with*r their*ir eyes*r and*r hear*r with*r their*ir ears,*r Lest*rld they*r should*r understand*r with*r their*ir hearts*r and*r turn,*r So*rld that*r I*r should*r heal*r them.’*r
But*rp blessed*r are*ir your*r eyes*r for*r they*r see,*r and*r your*r ears*r for*r they*r hear;*r

for*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r many*r prophets*r and*r righteous*r men*ir desired*r to*r see*r what*r you*r see,*r and*r did*r not*r see*r it,*ir and*r to*r hear*r what*r you*r hear,*r and*r did*r not*r hear*r it.*ir
The Parable of the Sower Explained
“Therefore*rp hear*r the*r parable*r of*r the*r sower:*r

When*r anyone*r hears*r the*r word*r of*r the*r kingdom,*r and*r does*r not*r understand*r it,*ir then*r the*r wicked*r one*ir comes*r and*r snatches*r away*r what*r was*r sown*r in*r his*r heart.*r This*r is*r he*r who*r received*r seed*r by*r the*r wayside.*r
But*r he*r who*r received*r the*r seed*r on*r stony*r places,*r this*r is*r he*r who*r hears*r the*r word*r and*r immediately*r receives*r it*r with*r joy;*r

yet*r he*r has*r no*r root*r in*r himself,*r but*r endures*r only*r for*r a*r while.*r For*r when*r tribulation*r or*r persecution*r arises*r because*r of*r the*r word,*r immediately*r he*r stumbles.*r

Now*r he*r who*r received*r seed*r among*r the*r thorns*r is*r he*r who*r hears*r the*r word,*r and*r the*r cares*r of*r this*r world*r and*r the*r deceitfulness*r of*r riches*r choke*r the*r word,*r and*r he*r becomes*r unfruitful.*r

But*r he*r who*r received*r seed*r on*r the*r good*r ground*r is*r he*r who*r hears*r the*r word*r and*r understands*r it,*ir who*r indeed*r bears*r fruit*r and*r produces:*r some*r a*r hundredfold,*r some*r sixty,*r some*r thirty.”*r
The Parable of the Wheat and the Tares
Another*p parable He put forth to them, saying: “The*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r a*r man*r who*r sowed*r good*r seed*r in*r his*r field;*r
but*r while*r men*r slept,*r his*r enemy*r came*r and*r sowed*r tares*r among*r the*r wheat*r and*r went*r his*r way.*r
But*r when*r the*r grain*r had*r sprouted*r and*r produced*r a*r crop,*r then*r the*r tares*r also*r appeared.*r
So*r the*r servants*r of*r the*r owner*r came*r and*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Sir,*r did*r you*r not*r sow*r good*r seed*r in*r your*r field?*r How*r then*r does*r it*r have*r tares?’*r
He*r said*r to*r them,*r ‘An*r enemy*r has*r done*r this.’*r The*r servants*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Do*r you*r want*r us*r then*r to*r go*r and*r gather*r them*r up?’*r

Let*r both*r grow*r together*r until*r the*r harvest,*r and*r at*r the*r time*r of*r harvest*r I*r will*r say*r to*r the*r reapers,*r “First*r gather*r together*r the*r tares*r and*r bind*r them*r in*r bundles*r to*r burn*r them,*r but*r gather*r the*r wheat*r into*r my*r barn.”’”*r
The Parable of the Mustard Seed

which*r indeed*r is*r the*r least*r of*r all*r the*r seeds;*r but*r when*r it*r is*r grown*r it*r is*r greater*r than*r the*r herbs*r and*r becomes*r a*r tree,*r so*r that*r the*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r come*r and*r nest*r in*r its*r branches.”*r
The Parable of the Leaven

Another*p parable He spoke to them: “The*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r leaven,*r which*r a*r woman*r took*r and*r hid*r in*r three*r measures*r of*r meal*r till*r it*r was*r all*r leavened.”*r
Prophecy and the Parables
All*p these things Jesus spoke to the multitude in parables; and without a parable He did not speak to them,
that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying: “I*pn will open My mouth in parables; I*ld will utter things kept secret from the foundation of the world.”
The Parable of the Tares Explained
Then*p Jesus sent the multitude away and went into the house. And His disciples came to Him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the tares of the field.”
He*p answered and said to them: “He*r who*r sows*r the*r good*r seed*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.*r
The*r field*r is*r the*r world,*r the*r good*r seeds*r are*r the*r sons*r of*r the*r kingdom,*r but*r the*r tares*r are*r the*r sons*r of*r the*r wicked*r one.*ir
The*r enemy*r who*r sowed*r them*r is*r the*r devil,*r the*r harvest*r is*r the*r end*r of*r the*r age,*r and*r the*r reapers*r are*r the*r angels.*r
Therefore*r as*r the*r tares*r are*r gathered*r and*r burned*r in*r the*r fire,*r so*r it*r will*r be*r at*r the*r end*r of*r this*r age.*r
The*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r send*r out*r His*r angels,*r and*r they*r will*r gather*r out*r of*r His*r kingdom*r all*r things*r that*r offend,*r and*r those*r who*r practice*r lawlessness,*r
and*r will*r cast*r them*r into*r the*r furnace*r of*r fire.*r There*r will*r be*r wailing*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.*r
Then*r the*r righteous*r will*r shine*r forth*r as*r the*r sun*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r their*r Father.*r He*r who*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear!*r

Jesus Rejected at Nazareth
Now*p it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these parables, that He departed from there.
When He had come to His own country, He taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished and said, “Where did this Man*i get this wisdom and these*i mighty works?
Is this not the carpenter’s son? Is not His mother called Mary? And His brothers James, Joses, Simon, and Judas?
And His sisters, are they not all with us? Where then did this Man*i get all these things?”
So they were offended at Him. But*p Jesus said to them, “A*r prophet*r is*r not*r without*r honor*r except*r in*r his*r own*r country*r and*r in*r his*r own*r house.”*r
